name: Langley
info: A Sinner who is adept at Long-Distance Output. Deals Core Damage when casting an Ultimate.
criminalRecord:
The current leader of the 9th Agency. The 9th Agency isn't big, but it is on the same administration level as FAC, and directly under Paradeisos. It is in charge of the DisCity's intelligence spies. The subject is known as a "cold-blooded Melanosuchus" and a "lapdog" due to the brutality, and has a bad reputation.

She was suspected of murdering the peace negotiator and disobeying orders, seriously endangering the safety of the city-state. She was sent to court but escaped from punishment for unknown reasons. Still a high-rank official who holds the DisCity's core political secrets to this day.
mutationAssessment:
+++* Ability Summary
Able to predict the required conditions needed to produce a specific result after firing the "Causality Gun" and able to manipulate the bullet to hit every target after completing all the conditions.

+++* Awakening Signs
Awakened during the BR-003 navigator observatory incident. Used special powers for the first time when insisting on assassinating an important individual. Case investigation not authorized.

+++* Corruption State
Awakened during the incubation period. No physical signs of mutation. Due to the subject's extremely strong mental power, the erosion and infection is weaker than average.
ecbFlavourText:
"I wager my life in exchange for a limited freedom... what a good deal."
"Everything is for the right cause."
servingTerm1: The subject insisted on settling in DisCity. Pour-over coffee tasting is her only personal hobby and a way to relax after work. The quality is on par with that of professional baristas.
servingTerm2: Notorious for being cruel, but very kind to subordinates. Her confinement cell is often visited by agents from the 9th Agency, and it is said that there have been many cordial greetings from her subordinates. "Before you hide yourself here to loaf away, Commander, please process these documents..."
servingTerm3: Pays close attention to MBCC Sinners. Interrogate any suspected restless Sinners, which was highly praised by some Sinners instead of causing discontent.
servingTerm4: Langley dislikes alcohol and believes alcohol can cause problems. But she can drink a lot and studied dozens of ways to "look as if you haven't drunk". Always succeed in teasing the Chief.
emotionCheck1:
[Langley looks weary.]

**Langley:** Rookie, go make a cup of coffee for me.

**Chief:** ......

* **Prompt:** I think what you need is resting instead of coffee.
 * **Langley:** It's a mediocre proposal, rookie.
 * **Langley:** ğŸ˜

* **Prompt:** You can try the Bureau's ground coffee.
 * **Langley:** Good. The coffee's pleasant smell alone is enough to brighten up my mood.
 * **Langley:** ğŸ˜‰
emotionCheck2:
[Langley sits on the the seat in your office.]

**Langley:** Rookie, how is your job going?

**Chief:** ......

* **Prompt:** I'm doing my part for world peace.
 * **Langley:** Good. But remember to watch yourself out there, rookie.
 * **Langley:** ğŸ˜

*  **Prompt:** I've carried out the Bureau's plan on schedule today.
 *  **Langley:** Oh? It's mediocre, but that's not enough.
 *  **Langley:** ğŸ˜¦
supervision1:
++* âš  Interrogation Method

//You see two people talking to each other about something.//

**System Notifications:** [[[Macchiato]]] came to chat with Langley. She seems to be curious about how Langley used to interrogate prisoners.

* **Prompt:** I am curious as well.
supervision2:
++* âš  Unknown Taste

//To your surprise, Langley serves you a cup of coffee.//

**System Notifications:** Lately, you often see several Sinners gather at your office door, whispering to each other and looking envious. You asked them and realized that they too wanted to taste Langley's ground coffee.

* **Prompt:** The taste is wonderful.
supervision3:
++* âš âš  The Tortured & the Torturer

//You hear the sound of someone knocking on the door.//

**System Notifications:** On the night after the mission went very successfully, Langley visited Chief's office with a bottle of vodka in her hand.

**Langley:** Soldier, would you like a drink?

**Chief:** I don't think that's a good idea... Bad things can happen if you get drunk.

**Langley:** I thought today called for a celebration.

* **Prompt:** Please spare me...
* **Prompt:** Please let me go...

**Chief:** Neither of us likes to drink. Why must you torture yourself?

**Langley:** Don't say that.

**Langley:** It has always been just you who is being tortured.

**Langley:** And you look adorable when you are being tortured. It amuses me. I can never get tired of it.

**Chief:** ...
supervision4:
++* âš âš  True Aim

//Someone is trying to enter the Supervision Center.//

**System Notifications:** Langley the Sinner asks to enter. Approve?

* **Prompt:** Yes

**Chief:** Is something the matter?

**Langley:** I think the security system of our Bureau needs an upgrade.

* **Prompt:** Why?
* **Prompt:** What's the matter?

**Langley:** I was in the Training Room and saw a strange drone above the Bureau, so I shot it down with my gun.

**Chief:** You just... broke the window and shot it down?

**Langley:** Yeah. Is there something wrong with that?

**Chief:** No. Not at all.

**Chief:** You are truly the strongest security measure in the Bureau...
supervision5:
++* âš âš âš  Iron Willpower

//Langley has stayed in the Confinement Cell for ten hours now. The system considers this behavior unusual. Head there now and check on her.//

**System Notifications:** Langley has stayed in the Confinement Cell for ten hours now. The system considers this behavior unusual. Head there now and check on her.

* **Prompt:** Confirm

**System Notifications:** Restoring Footage ...

**System Notifications:** This Sinner is in her Confinement Cell alone, using her access to try multiple unique therapy measures. Would you like to ask this Sinner questions?

* **Prompt:** Yes

**Chief:** Langley...

**Chief:** Did you spend some time alone in a Confinement Cell?

**Langley:** Yes.

**Langley:** That's actually why I'm here to talk to you.

**Langley:** The therapy measures in the Confinement Cell are too weak. They don't serve as punishments.

**Langley:** I suggest that we increase the overall intensity.

* **Prompt:** Directly decline
 * **Chief:** But these measures went through professional assessments. They are certainly enough, if not too intense.
 * **Chief:** They are already intense enough to potentially break some Sinners.
 * **Langley:** Then it's the standards being set too low. And the Sinners are too weak.
 * **Langley:** If they can't even take this level of pain, how are they supposed to protect this city?

* **Prompt:** There is room for improvement.
 * **Chief:** Our assessment showed that these measures are so intense that they could potentially break some Sinners.
 * **Chief:** But perhaps we can adjust and customize the measures according to the characteristics of different Sinners.
 * **Langley:** Alright. I'll be there to test and assess the measures myself.
baseVoicelines: [Obtain the Sinner] Handcuffing your own boss... You've got balls, rookie. Come on then, show me what you have on me. [Raise to Phase 1] Carefulâ€”â€”You're in my crosshairs. [Raise to Phase 3] You don't deserve to see sunlight, filthy sewer scum! [Level Start] Let me see how you flee like rats. [Win Battles] Good job. Let's go back and celebrate. [Lose Battles] Retreat. I can't waste the valuable lives of my subordinates here. [Ultimate Skill] Time to die. [Die in Battles] Somebody... will carry on this will... [Greeting] You're late, rookie. Any progress on the mission? [Conversation 1] Do you like my cane? I'll let you borrow it. Beware though, there are quite a few hidden parts inside... Don't injure yourself. [Conversation 2] Crawl into darkness, bloody your hands... My subordinates do not need justice. Loyalty is their greatest virtue. [Conversation 3] What do they call the 9th Agency? A bunch of spiders in the shadows, a gang of merciless lackeys? Hmm... I like that. Their hatred comes from fear, and fear... is the favorite weapon of spies. [Special Conversation 1] Don't stress over the protocol. You have free rein to do whatever you see fit. Be confident. You work under me. [Special Conversation 2] I wish... for world peace. Can you believe it? [Special Conversation 3] Are you curious about this little accessory on my temple? You don't have to know what it is. It's nothing more than... my occasional vanity. [Full Compliance] Never ask me for truths, rookie. Some truths can only be traded for with blood. Some day, I'll carry them to the grave. As for you... you'll live on. I'll let you live on, with my city, through the dark night, into the dawn of a new day. [Idle] Hmm... Who should I get rid of next? [Annoyed] Are you sure? Losing your job and losing your life are both rather inconvenient consequences. [Special Attention] Just staring at me won't get you the intelligence you're after. What, need me to teach you some torture skills, rookie? [Dispatch] Oh? You want me to tend to this matter personally? [Dispatch Complete] Want firsthand intelligence? Come get it in my office tonight. [Level Up] Targetâ€”â€”locked on. [Pat Head] Wanna try on this hat, or try my bullets?
attireVoicelines1:
[Attire Obtained]
Everything is progressing smoothly. But I must say, your presence... makes this party even more interesting.

[Greeting]
I don't want to hear your report. That's for tomorrow. Enjoy the partyâ€”â€”that's the most important task at hand.

[Ordinary Contact 1]
You came too early, rookie. Is it because you don't trust me, or... you want to watch me complete the mission with your own eyes? I hope your answer is the latter.

[Ordinary Contact 2]
Looks clear but tastes zestyâ€”â€”this is what's special about Mitsumasa, the liquor that Kenichi Yagyu is most proud of. Just like Syndicate gangs... seemingly innocuous on the surface, but with sharp blades hidden underneath. Don't you think so, rookie?

[Ordinary Contact 3]
Some truths can only be exchanged for blood, but this time... I don't want to make too much of a ruckus.

[Ordinary Contact 4]
Don't be so nervous, rookie. You won't get any intelligence with that sullen face... Come, sit and have a drink with me. Show some respect to this party and its host by enjoying it.

[Idle] 
Please give my friend a glass of orange juiceâ€”â€”she can't handle such a strong drink.

[Special Attention] 
All the intelligence is here. If you want it, come and stay with me after the party... to sort out the information, of course.

[Level Up}
Let me enjoy this party even more.

[Pat Head]
Prairie gentian, yellow iris, camellia... Which flower shall I adorn my hair with?
nightmareTalent: All allied Reticle Sinners gain a 12% damage boost.

exclusiveCrimebrand.name: Traitor
exclusiveCrimebrand.description: When Langley performs [Gunfire Edict], she inflicts a [Causality] mark on all enemies within the skill range and gains 10%/12.5%/15% additional Attack Speed for 10 seconds.
exclusiveCrimebrand.flavourText:
"I wager my life in exchange for a limited freedom... what a good deal."
"Everything is for the right cause."

crimebrandSets.name: Tuning + Pandora
crimebrandSets.note: Pandora procs on Causality stacks, allowing Langley to make better use of Pandora than most characters.

crimebrandSets.name: Prisoner of the Deep
crimebrandSets.note: Prevents Langley from ulting, but she benefits from all 3 buffs the CB provides.</br>However, if you have an abundance of Empowers I don't feel like it's worth running because Langley's Ult can hit anywhere on the map, deals 1 Core Dmg, and allows you to instantly apply Causality to a crowd.

crimebrandSets.name: Tuning + City + Contamination
crimebrandSets.note: Pioneer is an alternative to Contamination. If you don't have that either, you can run Corridor Echo in third slot.

crimebrandSets.name: Solo Dance
crimebrandSets.note: Increases Langley's NA damage by 25%, so long as there are no enemies within Langley's 3x3, which should be easier to achieve thanks to Langely's long range.

crimebrandSets.name: Imaginary Gambit
crimebrandSets.note: Provides a good damage boost if your movement count is odd. Since Langley's range is very high, she's unlikely to be damaged standing at the back. Therefore you may have a better character to put this on who can make use of both sides of the set bonus passive.

crimebrandSets.name: Tower + Inversion
crimebrandSets.note: Generates energy and allows Langley to deal more NA damage from the increased Crit chance and extra NAs, proccing her P2 [Execution of Fate] faster.</br>However, other characters that deal more NA dmg/whose abilities are able to Crit will make better use of this set than Langley, such as Shalom, Lady Pearl, Adela, Mantis, etc.

crimebrandSets.name: Diverged Ends
crimebrandSets.note: If you're running this set, I'm guessing you don't have Pandora or City available. Diverged Ends makes Langley deal 12% more damage for 10s after killing an enemy. Move Langley to get Singularity Atkspd buff.

crimebrandSets.name: Eastside: Dream
crimebrandSets.note: Early game alternative when you don't have anything better.

shackles.title: Confidential
shackles.description: For enemies marked with [Causality]: Damage Taken increases 10%.

shackles.title: Sneak Attack
shackles.description: When an enemy with [Causality] mark dies, Langley gains a 10% Attack bonus for 10 seconds.

shackles.title: Emotion Resonance
shackles.description: Ultimate Energy Consumption is reduced by 3 points.

skills.name: Immediate Execution
skills.description: Langley attacks with her pistol, dealing (113% of Attack damage) Physical Damage each time.

skills.name: Gunfire Edict
skills.description: Langley grants [Pardons] with her bullets, firing 5 shots to enemies within her range. Each shot deals (180% of Attack damage) Physical Damage to an enemy. The first shot deals 1 Core Damage.

skills.name: Causality
skills.description: When dealing damage to enemies, Langley marks them with [Causality]. Then, when she deals damage to an enemy, she deals (35% of her Attack) additional Physical Damage to those enemies marked with [Causality].

skills.name: Execution of Fate
skills.description: When the enemy marked with [Causality] dies, deals (200% of own attack) Physical Damage to all enemies in that grid.

compliance: Unlock File: Performance in Serving Terms, Attack +6
Unlock Voice: Special Conversation 1, Attack +6, Unlock Mission: Dispatch Langley 2 times
Unlock File: Performance in Serving Term
Unlocking data: monitoring records, Unlock Voice: full obedience, Unlock Sinner Title: between cause and effect
attireVoicelines2:
[Attire Obtained]
Well, it seems that scurvy didn't take you down. That's my first mate for you. Now, everyone, back to your stations. Hoist the anchor, and raise the sails. The "Madame Maelstrom" is setting sail again!

[Greeting]
You're awake, first mate. Still savoring the aftertaste of yesterrday's revelry? Relax, I'm not accusing you. Obey orders, enjoy yourself, and fight to your heart's content... These are the only rules on this "Madame Maelstrom".

[Ordinary Contact 1]
City... special agency... the 9th Agency? What are you yapping about? Chef, there's something off with that barrel of tequila. Dump it all into the sea.

[Ordinary Contact 2]
The storm's brewing. First mate, tell the crew to change course for the nearest safe harbor... Save our courage for the enemies. There's no point in fighting the sea itself... It will get you nothing but a broken mast.

[Ordinary Contact 3]
Paradeisos? Don't worry, they won't bother me... You want to know about my relationship with them? Well, those who know that secret are either on the throne or at the bottom of the sea. Which one do you plan to be?

[Ordinary Contact 4]
One of these days, I'll hand over this hat, along with this ship, to you. But before that, you've got to prove your worth.

[Idle] 
Dare slack off and nap in front of your captain? You're bold, my dear first mate.

[Special Attention] 
Welcome back, my first mate. How are things on that island? How many are stationed there? How many cannons do they have? Excellent scouting. Seems like our prey is about to show its weak spot.

[Level Up}
This ship could use all the extra firepower we can get.

[Pat Head]
Great, Feed 'em to the sharks.
supervision6:
++* âš âš âš  Who's the Boss

//Even in the Bureau, Langley never forgets to micromanage your work.//

**System Notifications:** Langley walks into your office.

**Langley:** Report your work, rookie.

* **Prompt:** What?

**Langley:** Have you done all the Sinner HR checking work in the Bureau?

* **Prompt:** Iâ€™m not afraid.

**Langley:** What a confident and bold answer. Why have you not submitted the work report to the 9th Agency yet?

* **Prompt:** I forgot...

**Langley:** Forgetting is always the worst excuse. Have you prepared a new memo for the routine meeting with the City Council today?

* **Prompt:** What meeting?

**Langley:** I knew it... Last but not least, how did you end up sleeping in the office again?

* **Prompt:** Complain
 * **Chief:** Ahem, I'm the Chief of the Bureau. Please do not forget your position.
 * **Langley:** Oh, is that true? You also shouldn't forget that even though I'm staying in the Bureau as a Sinner, I'm still your direct supervisor.
 * **Langley:** You need to obey my orders, not the other way round.
 * **System Notifications:** Seeing you get tensed up, Langley smiles.
 * **Langley:** Alright, I was just joking. I know you've been busy with work lately. As your senior, I haven't given you enough support either.
 * **Langley:** I'll transfer some resources from the 9th Agency to aid your work. Remember to report to me in my office later today.
 * **Chief:** Yes, understood! Ms Langley!
 * **Langley:** No need for the honorific. After all, nominally, I'm your Sinner.
 * **Langley:** Go do your job, Chief.

* **Prompt:** Obey Langley reluctantly
 * **Chief:** I worked till too late last night and dozed off... My apologies for that!
 * **System Notifications:** Seeing your guilty face, Langley gives a sigh.
 * **Langley:** It's not my intention to stress you out too much. In fact, you're already my most... I mean, one of my most outstanding subordinates.
 * **Langley:** If I assign all the work to one person, even you won't be able to handle it.
 * **Langley:** I'll trim some unnecessary parts in the workflow and assign the more trivial tasks to other departments.
 * **Chief:** Thank you, Ms Langley.
 * **Langley:** No need to thank me, rookie. Show me your gratitude with good work.
 * **Langley:** I'm looking forward to your future performance.

voicelines.Ordinary Contact 1 - EN: You came too early, rookie. Is it because you don't trust me, or... you want to watch me complete the mission with your own eyes? I hope your answer is the latter.

voicelines.Attire Obtained - EN: Well, it seems that scurvy didn't take you down. That's my first mate for you. Now, everyone, back to your stations. Hoist the anchor, and raise the sails. The "Madame Maelstrom" is setting sail again!

voicelines.Greeting - EN: You're awake, first mate. Still savoring the aftertaste of yesterday's revelry? Relax, I'm not accusing you. Obey orders, enjoy yourself, and fight to your heart's content... These are the only rules on this "Madame Maelstrom".

voicelines.Ordinary Contact 2 - EN: The storm's brewing. First mate, tell the crew to change course for the nearest safe harbor... Save our courage for the enemies. There's no point in fighting the sea itself... It will get you nothing but a broken mast.
